7525bbe3632d.name: Beef Wellington
cooking_method: Preheat the oven to 200C/400F.
Season the beef fillet with salt and pepper, then sear in a hot pan with olive oil until browned all over. Allow to cool.
Lay a sheet of cling film on a work surface and place the prosciutto on it, slightly overlapping each slice. Spread the duxelles over the prosciutto.
Place the beef fillet in the centre and use the cling film to roll the prosciutto and duxelles around it, pressing tightly to make a compact cylinder. Chill in the fridge for 10-15 minutes.
Roll out the puff pastry on a floured surface to a size that will wrap around the beef. Remove the cling film from the beef and place in the centre of the pastry.
Brush the edges of the pastry with beaten egg and fold the pastry over the beef, pressing the edges to seal. Trim the ends if necessary.
Brush the pastry all over with beaten egg.
Bake for 20-25 minutes for medium-rare beef. Allow to rest for 10 minutes before slicing and serving.

7525bbe3632d.name: Scrambled Eggs
cooking_method: Whisk the eggs together in a bowl with salt and pepper.
Melt the butter in a non-stick pan over low heat.
Add the eggs and stir constantly with a spatula, scraping the bottom of the pan regularly.
Cook until the eggs are just set but still slightly runny.
Remove from the heat and stir in the chives.
Serve immediately.

7525bbe3632d.name: Pan-Seared Salmon
cooking_method: Season the salmon fillet with salt and black pepper.
Heat olive oil in a non-stick pan over medium-high heat.
Place the salmon fillet, skin side down, in the pan and cook for 4-5 minutes until golden brown and crispy.
Flip the salmon over and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes until the flesh is opaque.
Serve with lemon wedges.

7525bbe3632d.name: Lamb Chops with Mint Sauce
cooking_method: Season the lamb chops with salt and black pepper.
Heat olive oil in a pan over high heat.
Add the lamb chops and sear for 2-3 minutes on each side until browned and cooked to your liking.
Remove the lamb chops from the pan and let them rest for a few minutes.
Meanwhile, make the mint sauce by blending together the mint leaves, garlic, honey, red wine vinegar, and a pinch of salt.
Serve the lamb chops with the mint sauce.

7525bbe3632d.name: Chicken Fajitas
cooking_method: Cut the chicken breasts into thin strips and season with salt, black pepper, cumin, paprika, chili powder, and garlic powder.
Cut the bell peppers and onion into thin strips.
Heat olive oil in a pan over high heat.
Add the chicken strips and cook for 2-3 minutes until browned.
Add the bell peppers and onion to the pan and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes until the vegetables are tender and the chicken is cooked through.
Serve the chicken and vegetables on flour tortillas.
